{{also|Gerade}} ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|grad}} {{qualifier|colloquial, only for the adverb}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ɡəˈraːdə/}} {{a|standard}} * {{IPA|de|/ˈɡraːdə/}} {{a|more commonly}} * {{audio|de|De-at-Gerade.ogg|Audio (Austria)}} * {{rhymes|de|aːdə}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|girat}} ====Adjective==== {{de-adj|-}} # [[even]] (number) #: ''Zahlen, die durch zwei teilbar sind, heißen '''gerade''' Zahlen.'' #:: Numbers divisible by two are called even numbers. =====Declension===== {{de-decl-adj-notcomp|gerad}} ====Adverb==== {{de-adv|-}} # [[now]], at the moment #: ''Ich bin '''gerade''' in der Küche.'' #:: I'm in the kitchen right now. # [[just]], a short while ago #: ''Ich war '''gerade''' in der Küche.'' #:: I've just been in the kitchen. # [[just]], [[only]], not more than #: ''Ich habe '''gerade''' mal fünf Euro.'' #:: All I have is five euro. # [[exactly]] #: ''Das ist '''gerade''' das Problem.'' #:: That exactly is the problem. # {{lb|de|Germany except Ruhr, Rheinland and Westphalia}} ''Expresses the [[continuous aspect]]. '' #:''Ich schaue das '''gerade'''.'' v. ''Ich schaue das.'' #:: I am watching that. v.
